verses.kjv: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.
verses.ct: Why do you brag about your evil deeds, powerful man? God's faithful love never ends.

verses.kjv: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
verses.ct: Your tongue plots destruction â€” it cuts like a sharpened razor, full of deceit.

verses.kjv: Thou lovest evil more than good; and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
verses.ct: You prefer evil over good, and lies over speaking the truth. Selah.

verses.kjv: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
verses.ct: You love every harmful word that comes from your deceptive mouth.

verses.kjv: God shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
verses.ct: So God will tear you down permanently. He will snatch you up, rip you from your home, and uproot you from the land of the living. Selah.

verses.kjv: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:
verses.ct: Those who do right will witness this and stand in awe, and they will laugh at him, saying:

verses.kjv: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.
verses.ct: "Look at the man who refused to make God his refuge! Instead, he relied on his great wealth and found his security in destruction."

verses.kjv: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
verses.ct: But I am like a thriving olive tree growing in God's house. I put my trust in God's mercy forever and ever.

verses.kjv: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it: and I will wait on thy name; for it is good before thy saints.
verses.ct: I will praise you forever for what you have done. I will place my hope in your name, because it is good in the presence of your faithful people.
